articles.headline: DeVos’s Hard Line on New Education Law Surprises States
articles.snippet: The education secretary, Betsy DeVos, who made a career of promoting local control of education, is taking a tough line on enforcing new federal standards.
articles.abstract: The education secretary, Betsy DeVos, who made a career of promoting local control of education, is taking a tough line on enforcing new federal standards.
articles.lead_paragraph: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos, who made a career of promoting local control of education, has signaled a surprisingly hard-line approach to carrying out an expansive new federal education law, issuing critical feedback that has rattled state school chiefs and conservative education experts alike.

articles.headline: Warren Buffett Invests in Canada, but Should You?
articles.snippet: Canada’s accounting standards are different from America’s. For instance, Sears Canada was pronounced “clean” just before it went bankrupt.
articles.abstract: Canada’s accounting standards are different from America’s. For instance, Sears Canada was pronounced “clean” just before it went bankrupt.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Warren Buffett acts, investors notice. And after he took a roughly $300 million position last month in Home Capital Group, a troubled Canadian mortgage underwriter, some investors saw it as a vote of confidence not only in that company, but also in Canadian stocks over all.

articles.headline: Trump Questions Putin on Election Meddling at Eagerly Awaited Encounter
articles.snippet: The meeting turned into a bright spot for Mr. Trump at the G-20 gathering, where the United States is finding itself increasingly isolated on other issues.
articles.abstract: The meeting turned into a bright spot for Mr. Trump at the G-20 gathering, where the United States is finding itself increasingly isolated on other issues.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAMBURG, Germany — President Trump questioned President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia on Friday about Moscow’s interference in the 2016 election, using their epic first face-to-face meeting to directly raise what has become a vexing political issue for the White House.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis, David E. Sanger and Glenn Thrush

articles.headline: Once Dominant, the United States Finds Itself Isolated at G-20
articles.snippet: On issues like trade and climate change, the Trump administration stands alone.
articles.abstract: On issues like trade and climate change, the Trump administration stands alone.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAMBURG, Germany — For years the United States was the dominant force and set the agenda at the annual gathering of the leaders of the world’s largest economies.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Julie Hirschfeld Davis

articles.headline: G.O.P. Support of Senate Health Repeal Erodes During Break
articles.snippet: The Senate’s bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act is now imperiled, facing new opposition from Republicans who fear its impact on rural communities.
articles.abstract: The Senate’s bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act is now imperiled, facing new opposition from Republicans who fear its impact on rural communities.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A week that Senate Republicans had hoped would mobilize conservatives and shore up support for their measure to repeal the Affordable Care Act instead ended with eroding enthusiasm, as usually reliable Republican senators from red states blanched at its impact on rural communities.
articles.byline: By Jennifer Steinhauer and Robert Pear

articles.headline: Amy Pascal’s Hollywood Ending, Complete With Comeback Twist
articles.snippet: After a humiliating 2014 cyberattack that helped lead to her ouster at Sony Pictures, the producer decided her life in the movie business was far from over.
articles.abstract: After a humiliating 2014 cyberattack that helped lead to her ouster at Sony Pictures, the producer decided her life in the movie business was far from over.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — After 18 years at Sony Pictures, the last 11 as studio boss, a position that made her one of the most powerful people in Hollywood, Amy Pascal had her life blown apart.

articles.headline: The Private Equity Firm That Quietly Profits on Top-Selling Drugs
articles.snippet: The little-known Royalty Pharma has built a portfolio of rights to drug-sale royalties now valued at $15 billion while largely avoiding public controversy.
articles.abstract: The little-known Royalty Pharma has built a portfolio of rights to drug-sale royalties now valued at $15 billion while largely avoiding public controversy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cashing in on rising drug prices often unleashes an outcry from consumers and politicians.

articles.headline: He Became a Hate Crime Victim. She Became a Widow.
articles.snippet: Srinivas Kuchibhotla’s death in an anti-immigrant attack at a Kansas bar made headlines the world over. Now his wife, Sunayana Dumala, tells her story.
articles.abstract: Srinivas Kuchibhotla’s death in an anti-immigrant attack at a Kansas bar made headlines the world over. Now his wife, Sunayana Dumala, tells her story.
articles.lead_paragraph: OLATHE, Kan. — Sunayana Dumala tried once again to enter the worship room she and her husband, Srinivas Kuchibhotla, had created in their home for daily prayers. Mr. Kuchibhotla had built an intricate wooden shrine by hand two years ago, a small sacred edifice where they would kneel each morning. Months after his death, it became a place where she would honor him.

articles.headline: ISIS, Despite Heavy Losses, Still Inspires Global Attacks
articles.snippet: The Islamic State’s territory-building project is crumbling, but it still has an international reach and an ideology that motivates attackers around the world.
articles.abstract: The Islamic State’s territory-building project is crumbling, but it still has an international reach and an ideology that motivates attackers around the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Three years ago, a black-clad cleric named Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi ascended a mosque pulpit in the Iraqi city of Mosul and addressed the world as leader of a new terrorist state.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: World Leaders Move Forward on Climate Change, Without U.S.
articles.snippet: At a G-20 summit meeting marred by violent protests, 19 other member states broke decisively with President Trump, in a victory for Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany.
articles.abstract: At a G-20 summit meeting marred by violent protests, 19 other member states broke decisively with President Trump, in a victory for Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAMBURG, Germany — World leaders struck a compromise on Saturday to move forward collectively on climate change without the United States, declaring the Paris accord “irreversible” while acknowledging President Trump’s decision to withdraw from the agreement.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger, Alison Smale, Lisa Friedman and Julie Hirschfeld Davis

articles.headline: Trump Team Met With Lawyer Linked to Kremlin During Campaign
articles.snippet: The meeting at Trump Tower in Manhattan was arranged by Donald Trump’s eldest son and was attended by Paul Manafort and Jared Kushner.
articles.abstract: The meeting at Trump Tower in Manhattan was arranged by Donald Trump’s eldest son and was attended by Paul Manafort and Jared Kushner.
articles.lead_paragraph: Update: The Times is now reporting that Donald Trump Jr. was promised damaging information about Hillary Clinton before the meeting. Read the story.
articles.byline: By Jo Becker, Matt Apuzzo and Adam Goldman

articles.headline: At Private Dinners, Pence Quietly Courts Big Donors and Corporate Executives
articles.snippet: Vice President Mike Pence has undertaken extensive personal outreach to donors, fueling speculation that he is preparing for his own political future.
articles.abstract: Vice President Mike Pence has undertaken extensive personal outreach to donors, fueling speculation that he is preparing for his own political future.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Vice President Mike Pence has been courting scores of the country’s most influential donors, corporate executives and conservative political leaders over the past several months in a series of private gatherings and one-on-one conversations.

articles.headline: Iraqi Prime Minister Arrives in Mosul to Declare Victory Over ISIS
articles.snippet: The monthslong battle led to about a thousand deaths among the Iraqi security forces and civilians. Officials must now confront a humanitarian crisis.
articles.abstract: The monthslong battle led to about a thousand deaths among the Iraqi security forces and civilians. Officials must now confront a humanitarian crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSUL, Iraq — Dressed in a military uniform, Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi arrived here in Mosul on Sunday to congratulate Iraq’s armed forces for wresting the city from the Islamic State. The victory marked the formal end of a bloody campaign that lasted nearly nine months, left much of Iraq’s second-largest city in ruins, killed thousands of people and displaced nearly a million more.
articles.byline: By Tim Arango and Michael R. Gordon

articles.headline: News Outlets to Seek Bargaining Rights Against Google and Facebook
articles.snippet: A group of news organizations plans to ask Congress for the right to negotiate with the online giants, which are gaining greater shares of digital advertising and distribution.
articles.abstract: A group of news organizations plans to ask Congress for the right to negotiate with the online giants, which are gaining greater shares of digital advertising and distribution.
articles.lead_paragraph: Google and Facebook continue to gobble up the digital advertising market, siphoning away revenue that once paid for the quality journalism that Google and Facebook now offer for free.

articles.headline: Trump’s Son Met With Russian Lawyer After Being Promised Damaging Information on Clinton
articles.snippet: Donald Trump Jr. is said to have arranged the meeting with the Kremlin-linked lawyer during the campaign after he was told he would be provided with details about Hillary Clinton.
articles.abstract: Donald Trump Jr. is said to have arranged the meeting with the Kremlin-linked lawyer during the campaign after he was told he would be provided with details about Hillary Clinton.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s eldest son, Donald Trump Jr., was promised damaging information about Hillary Clinton before agreeing to meet with a Kremlin-connected Russian lawyer during the 2016 campaign, according to three advisers to the White House briefed on the meeting and two others with knowledge of it.
articles.byline: By Jo Becker, Matt Apuzzo and Adam Goldman

articles.headline: AT&T’s Blockbuster Deal for Time Warner Hangs in Limbo
articles.snippet: Eight months into its review, the Justice Department still has stumbling blocks in assessing the most significant business deal before the Trump administration.
articles.abstract: Eight months into its review, the Justice Department still has stumbling blocks in assessing the most significant business deal before the Trump administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At the Department of Justice, staff members in the antitrust office have been doggedly investigating AT&T’s blockbuster $85.4 billion bid for Time Warner.
articles.byline: By Cecilia Kang and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Michigan’s New Motor City: Ann Arbor as a Driverless-Car Hub
articles.snippet: Fostered by the University of Michigan, testing and research programs draw companies and even equip residents’ vehicles to collect and transmit data.
articles.abstract: Fostered by the University of Michigan, testing and research programs draw companies and even equip residents’ vehicles to collect and transmit data.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANN ARBOR, Mich. — As the world looks ahead to a future of interconnected, self-driving cars, this college town 40 miles west of Detroit has emerged as a one-of-a-kind, living laboratory for the technologies that will pave the way.

articles.headline: Why Some Online Video Stars Opt for Facebook Over YouTube
articles.snippet: The best-known video celebrities gravitate to the mass audience of YouTube. But some others are carving a niche on the worlds biggest social network.
articles.abstract: The best-known video celebrities gravitate to the mass audience of YouTube. But some others are carving a niche on the worlds biggest social network.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Laura Clery has the trappings of a YouTube star — seven-figure annual earnings, brand sponsorships and millions of fans who watch her comedy videos — except for one notable difference: She’s finding fame and fortune on Facebook.

articles.headline: Neomi Rao, the Scholar Who Will Help Lead Trump’s Regulatory Overhaul
articles.snippet: She is expected to run an obscure but powerful office at the heart of Mr. Trump’s plan to reshape government rules.
articles.abstract: She is expected to run an obscure but powerful office at the heart of Mr. Trump’s plan to reshape government rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When George Mason University changed the name of its law school last year to honor Antonin Scalia, the late conservative Supreme Court justice, the tribute rankled many liberal faculty members and students. That the naming was tied to a multimillion-dollar donation from the conservative Charles Koch Foundation only heightened concerns.

articles.headline: Long After Protests, Students Shun the University of Missouri
articles.snippet: The college has had to close dorms and cut jobs because of plummeting enrollment, which officials attribute largely to fallout from protests in 2015.
articles.abstract: The college has had to close dorms and cut jobs because of plummeting enrollment, which officials attribute largely to fallout from protests in 2015.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBIA, Mo. — In the fall of 2015, a grassy quadrangle at the center of the University of Missouri became known nationwide as the command center of an escalating protest.

articles.headline: China’s Wanda Signals Retreat in Debt-Fueled Acquisition Binge
articles.snippet: The Chinese conglomerate said it would sell $9.3 billion in hotels and tourism projects, and would use the cash to pay off loans.
articles.abstract: The Chinese conglomerate said it would sell $9.3 billion in hotels and tourism projects, and would use the cash to pay off loans.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — A year ago, the Chinese billionaire Wang Jianlin declared the dominance of his vast entertainment empire, Dalian Wanda Group, boasting that his theme parks were a “pack of wolves” that would defeat the lone “tiger” of Disney’s Shanghai resort.

articles.headline: Spyware in Mexico Targeted Investigators Seeking Students
articles.snippet: Investigators looking for 43 students who vanished after clashing with the police say the spying took place during a campaign to block them from solving the case.
articles.abstract: Investigators looking for 43 students who vanished after clashing with the police say the spying took place during a campaign to block them from solving the case.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — A team of international investigators brought to Mexico to unravel one of the nation’s gravest human rights atrocities was targeted with sophisticated surveillance technology sold to the Mexican government to spy on criminals and terrorists.
